name: Non-preferred NSAIDs and COX-2 inhibitors
title: NSAIDs (including COX-2 inhibitors) - percentage items excluding naproxen and ibuprofen
description: Number of prescription items for all NSAIDs excluding ibuprofen and naproxen as a percentage of the total items for all NSAIDs
y_label: Percentage of all NSAID items which aren't naproxen and ibuprofen
why_it_matters: There have been a number of concerns about the safety of a number of anti-inflammatory drugs, including COX-2 inhibitors and some
'traditional' NSAIDS, for their effects on the stomach, kidneys and the risk of blood clots.
in patients with ischaemic heart disease, cerebrovascular disease, or peripheral arterial disease ibuprofen (up to 1200mg per day) and naproxen (up to 1000mg) should be prescribed first-line
and COX-2 inhibitors, diclofenac, and high-dose ibuprofen are contraindicated
